intro: Anethum erythraeum, commonly known as the Ethiopian cumin or red cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are often used as a spice in various cuisines. Its aromatic seeds contain essential oils that contribute to its distinctive flavor and medicinal properties. Anethum erythraeum thrives in dry, arid conditions and is well adapted to the climate of its native region.
